feed.title: Miereâ€™s Personal Observations
feed.subtitle: Personal observations made by myself. I write about technology, software engineering, history and, ocasionally, politics. I shall try my best to keep it as scientific as possible, using facts to support my point of view. Hopefully, you will give me a hand whenever I did a mistake.

entry.title: Producing professional deliverables
entry.content: It was 2008 when I first received a bad feedback about a job I did. My team was performing 360 Degree Feedback. The feedbacks were appaling. I never had that feeling before. Why did people feel like I was a complete fraud? I mean, they complained quite a lot about how they were supposed to maintain such a messy service. One, even asked me if I got any mental problem.
entry.summary: It was 2008 when I first received a bad feedback about a job I did. My team was performing 360 Degree Feedback. The feedbacks were appaling. I never had that feeling before. Why did people feel like I was a complete fraud? I mean, they complained quite a lot about how they were supposed to maintain such a messy service. One, even asked me if I got any mental problem.
